conclusion: Analyze the situation of the suspended copper rod in a magnetic field to find the current's magnitude and direction.
Copper rod MN is suspended horizontally by two wires in a magnetic field B directed into the paper.
When the rod is not energized, tension T keeps the rod in equilibrium.
Magnetic force on the rod is given by F_m = BI(A/2).
For rotation, magnetic force must equal or exceed tension: F_m = T.
Tension in wires is 1/4 of original when rod is energized: T' = 1/4 T.
BI(A/2) = 1/4 x 2T, leading to BI = 1/2 T.
Magnitude of current I is 1/2 T/B.
Direction of current determined by right-hand rule is from M to N.
Magnitude of current is 1/2 T/B and direction is from M to N.
